001package com.technototes.library.command;
002
003import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
004
005import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
006
007/**
008 * Simple class for commands that require a certain condition to be true to run
009 * <p>
010 * This encapsulates *two* different capabilities.
011 * 1. A ConditionalCommand with only a condition, but no commands, is a a "wait" command.
012 * It will only finish once the condition is true.
013 * 2. A ConditionalCommand with a condition and a true (and optionally false) command
014 * is a generic "if/else" command: If the condition is true, execute the 'true command',
015 * if not true, execute the 'false command' if it is supplied.
016 * <p>
017 * TODO: This makes the class a little clunky. It wouldn't be terrible to break the functionality
018 * TODO: out into multiple classes instead
019 *
020 * @author Alex Stedman
021 */
022public class ConditionalCommand implements Command {
023    private BooleanSupplier supplier;
024    @Nullable private Command trueCommand, falseCommand;
025
026    /**
027     * This makes a "wait" command
028     *
029     * @param condition The BooleanSupplier that will be waited upon until true
030     */
031    public ConditionalCommand(BooleanSupplier condition) {
032        supplier = condition;
033        trueCommand = null;
034        falseCommand = null;
035    }
036
037    /**
038     * Make a conditional command
039     *
040     * @param condition The condition
041     * @param command   The command to run when the condition is true.
042     */
043    public ConditionalCommand(BooleanSupplier condition, Command command) {
044        supplier = condition;
045        trueCommand = command;
046        CommandScheduler.getInstance().scheduleWithOther(this, trueCommand, condition);
047        falseCommand = null;
048    }
049
050    /**
051     * Make a conditional command
052     *
053     * @param condition The condition
054     * @param trueC     The command to run when the condition is true
055     * @param falseC    The command to run when the condition is false
056     */
057    public ConditionalCommand(BooleanSupplier condition, Command trueC, Command falseC) {
058        supplier = condition;
059        trueCommand = trueC;
060        falseCommand = falseC;
061        CommandScheduler.getInstance().scheduleWithOther(this, trueCommand, condition);
062        CommandScheduler.getInstance().scheduleWithOther(this, falseCommand, () -> !condition.getAsBoolean());
063    }
064
065    @Override
066    public void execute() {}
067
068    @Override
069    public boolean isFinished() {
070        if (trueCommand == null) return supplier.getAsBoolean();
071        if (falseCommand == null) return trueCommand.justFinished();
072        return trueCommand.justFinished() || falseCommand.justFinished();
073    }
074}
